comments.raw_text:
I try to triage my review queue once a week or so. However, really small patches are easier to just review right away. I'd like Bugzilla to include some info about the size of the patch when someone requests review from me on a patch attachment. Something like the summary line from "diffstat" would be great:
 2 files changed, 92 insertions(+), 2 deletions(-)

but any similar output would be really helpful. That way I'd be able to tell if a patch is trivial and review it right away.

comments.raw_text:
Diffstats in bugmail would be very helpful for improving review turnaround time for trivial patches. Reviewers could also use the diffstat's list of changed filenames to identify patches that should be bounced to a different reviewer.

Bugmail for confidential bugs should probably not include a diffstat.
